page.title: 20BIDEFORD ARCHIVE
page.content: IN 1981 A GROUP OF TEACHERS FORMED A {LOCAL STUDY GROUP}THROUGH THE TEACHERS CENTRE. IN 1982 THE{LOCAL HISTORY {SOCIETY}WAS REFORMED WITH THE AIM OF ENCOURAGING RESEARCH INTO BIDEFORDS PAST. THE{M.S.C}GRANTED FUNDS TO EMPLOY PEOPLE AND SET UP{THE BIDEFORD {COMMUNITY ARCHIVE.}THE ARCHIVE IS NOW IN ITS THIRD YEAR FUNDED BY THE M.S.C. & IS HOUSED IN{BIDEFORD COMPREHENSIVE {SCHOOL.}RESOURCE PACKS ARE PRODUCED FOR SCHOOLS AND LOCAL ORGANISATIONS. BUILDINGS HAVE BEEN PHOTOGRAPHED AND SURVEYED, ARCHIVAL{MATERIAL COLLECTED AND STORED, LOCAL INHABITANTS INTERVIEWED AND PHOTOGRAPHED AS PART OF THE ARCHIVE. THE ARCHIVE NOW COMES UNDER THE CONTROL OF THE{COMMUNITY THROUGH REPRESENTATIVES OF LOCAL INSTITUTIONS. IT EXISTS TO SERVE THE COMMUINITY.FOR RESEARCH, DOCUMENTATION OF{BIDEFORDS PAST, PRESENT AND FUTURE.
